remarks: The predicate "is an orthoposet."  (Contributed by NM, 20-Oct-2011.) (Revised by NM, 14-Sep-2018.)
statement:
isopos.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
isopos.e $e |- U = ( lub ` K ) $.
isopos.g $e |- G = ( glb ` K ) $.
isopos.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
isopos.o $e |- ._|_ = ( oc ` K ) $.
isopos.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
isopos.m $e |- ./\ = ( meet ` K ) $.
isopos.f $e |- .0. = ( 0. ` K ) $.
isopos.u $e |- .1. = ( 1. ` K ) $.
isopos $p |- ( K e. OP <-> ( ( K e. Poset /\ B e. dom U /\ B e. dom G ) /\ A. x e. B A. y e. B ( ( ( ._|_ ` x ) e. B /\ ( ._|_ ` ( ._|_ ` x ) ) = x /\ ( x .<_ y -> ( ._|_ ` y ) .<_ ( ._|_ ` x ) ) ) /\ ( x .\/ ( ._|_ ` x ) ) = .1. /\ ( x ./\ ( ._|_ ` x ) ) = .0. ) ) ) $.
$d ._|_ x y $.
$d B x y $.
$d K x y $.
